newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat ends broadly lower after late slide.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat ends broadly lower after late slide.

text.p: A late, CBOT-inspired slide helped compound earlier losses and caused KCBT hard red winter wheat futures to end broadly lower, traders said.
Technical selling, a lack of export news and spillover pressure from CBOT grains undermined KCBT wheat throughout Wednesday's session.
"There was a rush to sell late, which compounded the negative tone we had seen all day," a trader said.
KCBT wheat closed six to 9-3/4 cents per bushel lower, with Sept down 8-1/2 cents at $4.58 a bushel.
Dec shed 9-1/4 cents to close at $4.55-3/4, which traders said was a new seasonal closing low.
Traders said CIS sold at least 2.6 million December bushels. FIMAT and Shay Grain each bear-spread 500,000 Dec/Sept bushels at two cents per bushel.
The KCBT estimated wheat futures volume at 28.89 million bushels, versus Tuesday's volume of 27.39 million bushels
